revised_title: The Separation and Excitation of Abductor and Adductor Fibres in the Recurrent Laryngeal Nerve
tldr: The author investigates the abductor and adductor fibers of the recurrent laryngeal nerve in dogs, finding that the abductor fibers are more prone to succumb before the adductors in affections of the nerve. The study provides insight into the arrangement and function of these fibers within the nerve trunk.
